Extract a subtree

Source: R/subTree.R
subTree.Rd

Takes a tibble representing a tree, and extracts a subtree at a given node.

Usage

subTree(tree_tibble, node)

Arguments

tree_tibble

A tree in the tbl_tree class of the tidytree package.

node

The ID number of the node to base the subtree.

Value

A subtree represented in the tbl_tree class of the tidytree package. This tibble has an extra node.orig column providing the old node IDs, because the node IDs in the object are renamed during the extraction of the subtree.

Examples

(subtree <- subTree(tibbleWithValue, 9))
#> # A tbl_tree abstraction: 7 × 7
#> # which can be converted to treedata or phylo 
#> # via as.treedata or as.phylo
#>   parent  node branch.length label        group Strand_Randomisation…¹ node.orig
#>    <int> <int>         <dbl> <chr>        <fct>                  <dbl>     <int>
#> 1      7     1         10.6  Halobacteri… 1                     NA             1
#> 2      6     2         12.3  Halobacteri… 1                     NA             2
#> 3      5     3         13.9  Salarchaeum… 1                     NA             5
#> 4      7     4         10.6  Halobacteri… 1                     NA             6
#> 5      5     5          1.75 NA           1                      0.131         9
#> 6      5     6          1.57 NA           1                      0.382        10
#> 7      6     7          1.70 NA           1                      0.393        11
#> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​Strand_Randomisation_Index
visualizeTree(subtree, subtree$node.orig)
#> Scale for y is already present.
#> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.
